name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Pocaterra Inn

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in early november for our anniversary. Our plan was to stay in Banff because that is where we were going to be spending most of our time anyway. After reading some reviews we chose to stay in Canmore instead. Very nice hotel. We had a room with a gas fireplace and jacuzzi tub and a king size bed, we really enjoy it all. Nice big room. Clean. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Very good continental breakfast as well. Never tried the pool but it looked okay. It is only 12 minutes to banff which isn't far at all if you don't want all the tourist and a little quieter place to stay. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Hard to select lodging near Banff with so many excellent choices, but am glad I booked with this Best Western. It's a notch up from the normal BW's, with a rustic theme, lodge-style; ice tea and cookies in the lobby were a nice touch (it was a warm summer weekend). Never made it to the pool but it looked like kids were having a blast on the waterslide. Staff was courteous and informative. Check in was a snap: I walked up, told them I had reservations, and in less than 1 minute we had room keys and were on our way. Comfortable bed, nice room with view. Mountains surround Canmore, so every room must have mountain views. Breakfast was basic muffins, bagels, croissants, fruit, cereal. If you want a hot breakfast, the Smitty's down the street is good.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay
One of the best Best Western properties
reviews.text: I stayed there on a busy night when the hotel was fully booked. We got a lovely room with a balcony with a view and a kitchenette. There was a fireplace in the room and everything was great, clean and neat. Much above the average Canadian standard in BW hotels. We did not get to use the pool since it was overcrowded, but enjoyed a late night talk on our balcony. Very friendly staff. The only drawback I can remember is the mechanism that closes the room doors which does this with a loud bang.
We stayed for three nights (wish it was longer!) and found this to be an excellent property.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: Our room was very spacious with king sized bed, arm chairs in front of an inset gas fire, a very large bathroom with jacuzzi and shower, large TV, music system, microwave oven, fridge and tea/coffee making facities. All areas within the hotel and room were very clean.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel! Nicely decorated, clean, the double bed rooms are very spacious, and the staff are helpful! The room size was a wonderful suprise as it seems a lot of chain hotel rooms are getting smaller and more basic. The snacks in the lobby upon check in was a nice touch and the breakfast included was good! Free internet access in the lobby and a fun pool adjacent to the hotel. For a hotel that belongs to such a large chain, it was great to see that this hotel really strives to treat each and every customer well and provides the comforts one might expect from a smaller, independent hotel. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking for a "hotel" accommodation in Canmore!
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel!

reviews.text: While most hotels in Banff, Jasper, and Lake Louise were over-priced and not even half as nice, the BW Pocaterra Inn was our favorite! Management and staff were friendly every time we dealt with them, from reservations over the phone to requests and questions at the front desk. Rooms were updated and clean, kids loved the pool , jacuzzi, and slide (all very clean). In addition to the continental breakfasts, freshly baked cookies and iced tea were available in the lobby in the afternoons. Our family had a wonderful stay here and wished more Canadian hotels were run in the same way. Highly recommended by a clean-freak with high standards!
reviews.title: Best place we stayed during our vacation!

likes.liked: — Friendly and helpful staff and cleanliness

reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Pocaterra at the end of our week long vacation in the Canadian Rockies. We spent two nights earlier in the week at the Rimrock Hotel in Banff at twice the price of the Pocaterra. I actually liked the Pocaterra better. Great climate control so we cooled it down for sleeping and then quickly warmed the room up in the morning with the fireplace and heat. We had a 2 queen fireplace nonsmoking room. The beds were great and the room/bathroom large and clean. We didn't use the pool but it looked like fun for the kids. If I had been traveling with children I would have made this hotel our base for Banff/Lake Louise. This was one of our least expensive rooms in high season at 170.00 Canadian through a AAA rate. The continental breakfast was great. I would highly recommend this hotel and would gladly stay there again.
reviews.title: Room as good as Rimrock in Banff
comfortable
reviews.text: the staff was very pleasant and helpful. the recreation facilities were kept clean and everything was working well. the layout of the hotel was practical (no need to wade through lobbies with swim suite), our room had a fridge and microwave which was very nice. even the hallways were nicely decorated with pictures and historical artifacts. well worth a stroll. the breakfast served was excellent. will very likely stay here again.

reviews.title: great hotel
reviews.text: we stayed at the pocaterra over easter, we found the hotel overall very good, the staff were always pleasant & helpful, the rooms were very nice also the fridge & microwave was a bonus as we had our 2 children with us, the complimentary breakfast was also good with a fair selection, the free coffee, hot chocolate & cookies were also a nice touch which were offered in reception daily, the pool was great for the kids & was open till 10pm. The hotel wasnt far from Banff just a short drive but note that there is a fee for entering banff national park approx $18 per family each day. Canmore is lovely some nice little shops, not as busy as banff, we thought it was a great location.

description: Nestled amidst the towering peaks of the Canadian Rockies, the Best Western Plus Pocaterra Inn is your ideal lodging choice while visiting Canmore Alberta. From the warm welcome in our lobby to our spacious guest rooms, you are sure to experience superior service while staying with us.Our hotel features tastefully decorated guest rooms with a multitude of amenities including stunning views of the surrounding Rocky Mountains, fireplaces, free high-speed wireless internet, microwaves, refrigerators, coffee makers, and LCD TV’s. Guests can enjoy our daily complimentary hot continental breakfast and access to our business centre, fitness facility, games room and meeting rooms. In addition, our hotel features a whirlpool, steam room, sauna and indoor swimming pool with a large waterslide perfect for the whole family to enjoy.Just minutes away from Banff National Park the Best Western Plus Pocaterra Inn is a great place to explore the Canadian Rockies, natural hot springs, lakes, glaciers, canyons, and ski resorts. When visiting Canmore Alberta, the Best Western Plus Pocaterra Inn will make your stay feel just like home, but better. Our relaxing atmosphere, tastefully appointed rooms and friendly hospitality are the perfect complement to your visit to the Canadian Rockies.
